result.execSummary:
This case has not been concluded. Unless a judgment of conviction is entered, the defendant is presumed innocent of all charges.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.
result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Luke Douglas Degler

records.addlTxt: Order to Produce filed by the State (sent to Br 1 Judge on 10/25/22 sp)
Sentencing Hearing set for 11/23/22 - insufficient address
Filed by Prosecutor.
Sentencing hearing on November 23, 2022 at 02:00 pm.
Plea Agreement

Defendant Luke Douglas Degler in court, in custody.  Attorney Jerod Barkley in court for Luke Douglas Degler.  Attorney Robert J Jambois in court for State of Wisconsin.  Victim is present via Zoom.
Cases heard at this time are 22CF-44, 22CF-120 and 22CF-271.

8:34 AM Court calls cases.
Atty Jambois states appearances.  

This is on for a plea and sentencing. 

Plea Questionnaire/Agreement filed.
Prosecutor states plea agreement.
22CF-44: Defendant will enter pleas to both counts. 
22CF-120: Defendant will enter pleas to Count 2 and Count 6. Remaining are dismissed and read in. 
22CF-271: Defendant will plead to Count 1 and Count 6. Remaining are dismissed and read in. 
Attorney for defendant concurs with agreement stated.
Defendant understands.

Court questions the parties as to why there is not a presentence investigation (PSI) requested.
Atty Jamobis explains.
Court will be requesting a presentence investigation, even though this is a joint recommendation.
Atty Barkely addresses the Court. 
Discussions continue. 

All parties will go forward with a plea today and the sentencing hearing will be set for another time.

State has complied with Victim Notification Statutes.
Victim is present via Zoom, does not wish to make a statement.

Defendant enters a plea of: 
22CF-44: Count 1:Guilty.
22CF-44: Count 2:Guilty.
22CF-120: Count 2: No Contest.
22CF-120: Count 6: No Contest.
22CF-271: Count 1: No Contest.
22CF-271: Count 6: No Contest.

Court questions defendant regarding plea questionnaire, waiver of constitutional rights and understandings.
Court advises defendant of elements the state must prove for the charge.
Court questions attorney for the defendant.
Court finds defendant's plea is freely, voluntarily, knowingly, and intelligently made.
Attorneys stipulate that there is factual basis for the charges.

BY THE COURT:
Court finds a sufficient factual basis to support the charges.
Court finds the defendant guilty of  22CF-44: Count 1; 22CF-44: Count 2; 22CF-120: Count 2; 22CF-120: Count 6; 22CF-271: Count 1 and 22CF-271: Count 6.
Clerk directed to enter judgment of convictions this date.
22CF-120: Count 1, Count 3, Count 4 and Count 5: Dismissed and read in. 
22CF-271: Count 2, Count 3, Count 4 and Count 5: Dismissed and read in. 

BY THE COURT: 
Court orders a PSI.
To be completed within 45 days. 

Parties are to meet with Judicial Assistant to get a sentencing date. 
Victims can address the Court at the time of the sentencing hearing. 

Victim's mother addresses the Court. Victim sent in a written statement on Tuesday.  This will be considered at the sentencing hearing. 

BY THE COURT:
Bond is revoked, remanded until the time of sentencing.
Plea Questionnaire/Waiver of Rights filed by Atty Jerod Barkley
filed by the State
Plea/Sentencing Hearing set for 09/16/22 - insufficient address
Plea/sentencing hearing on September 16, 2022 at 08:30 am.
matter set for plea/sent 9/16/22 at 8:30

10:01 AM Defendant Luke Douglas Degler in court.  Assistant District Attorney (ADA) Robert J Jambois in court for State of Wisconsin.  Attorney Jerod Barkley in court for Luke Douglas Degler. 

Court calls the case.
ADA Jambois states the appearances.

Court has received the competency evaluation report filed on June 9, 2022.
Parties have each received their copies and have reviewed.
Defendant is competent to proceed.
Atty Barkley has reviewed the findings of the report with his client.
Defendant will indicate that he is competent to proceed.
Court questions the defendant.
State does not wish to contest.
Neither party will object to the court using the report to make its determination.
Atty Barkley will not be calling any witnesses.
ADA Jambois states that an offer had been conveyed.
Competency had been raised at the preliminary hearing; Atty Barkley states that competency had been raised on one of the cases but not on the other.
Atty Barkley will waive time limits on 22CF120.

BY THE COURT:
Defendant is competent to proceed.
Case to be set for a preliminary hearing on 22CF120.
Bonds previously set on each case are continued.
Pre-trial conference scheduled for July 18, 2022 at 08:30 am.
Pre-trial conference on July 18, 2022 at 08:30 am.
Cover Sheet for Confidential Records and Competency Report filed by Wisconsin Forensic Unit (sent to Br 1 Judge/JA on 06/09/22 sp)
Pre-trial conference on June 13, 2022 at 10:00 am.

Order for Competency Examination by Department of Health Services /s/ TBE 05/10/22
sent to DHS/MMHI, WFU/BC and WCS on 05/11/22 sp
Order for Competency Evaluation by Department of Health Services filed by Atty Jerod Barkley (sent to Br 1 Judge on 05/10/22 sp)
Defendants Motion for Competency Examination filed by Atty Jerod Barkley (sent to Br 1 Judge/JA on 05/10/22 sp)
matter scheduled for ptc 6/13/22 at 10:00
Defendant Record Update
Pre-trial conference on May 9, 2022 at 08:30 am.
matter scheduled for ptc 5/9/22 at 8:30
Exhibit P#1 - Copy of Criminal Complaint
Pre-trial conference on March 21, 2022 at 08:30 am.

Defendant received copy of information.
Defendant waives reading of information. 

NOT GUILTY plea(s) entered.

BY THE COURT:  Bond continued.

03:38 PM Defendant Luke Douglas Degler in court with Attorney (Atty) Jerod Barkley. Prosecuting Assistant District Attorney (ADA) Robert J Jambois appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
ADA Jambois calls Officer Denault who is sworn in and testifies during direct exam.
Exhibit P#1 is marked and referred to during direct exam.
Cross exam by Atty Barkley.
Re-direct exam by ADA Jambois.
Court questions the officer.
Objection by ADA Jambois was overruled.
Re-direct by ADA Jambois.
Re-cross exam by Atty Barkley.  No further witnesses.
ADA Jambois moves exhibit P#1 to be received.
No objections.
  BY THE COURT: Exhibit P#1 is received.
Final statements of ADA Jambois are heard by the Court.
Final statements of Atty Barkley are heard.
  BY THE COURT: Court finds it is probable that a felony was committed and this defendant committed it and binds the defendant over for trial.  Pre-trial conference scheduled for March 21, 2022 at 08:30 am.
Preliminary hearing on February 21, 2022 at 03:00 pm.

01:25 PM Defendant Luke Douglas Degler in court with Attorney (Atty) Jerod Barkley. Prosecuting Assistant District Attorney (ADA) Brian J Pfeil appeared for the State of Wisconsin.

Attorney/Defendant received a copy of the criminal complaint.
Court informs defendant of the charges and maximum penalties.
Attorney/Defendant waives reading of the complaint.
Attorney waives time limits for the preliminary hearing to be held.

Court advises defendant of right to counsel/public defender representation.

BY THE COURT:  Bond continued.  Preliminary hearing scheduled for February 21, 2022 at 03:00 pm.
